paper_keywords: Small universal spiking neural P system
Time efficient spiking neural P system
paper_abstract: It is shown here that there is no standard spiking neural P system that simulates Turing machines with less than exponential time and space overheads. The spiking neural P systems considered here have a constant number of neurons that is independent of the input length. Following this, we construct a universal spiking neural P system with exhaustive use of rules that simulates Turing machines in linear time and has only 10 neurons.
paper_title: On the computational complexity of spiking neural P systems
